title: Ops Resilience: First Signs
description: Unusual power fluctuations across Singapore's grid. The readings don't match any known fault pattern. DIS suspects a sophisticated cyber intrusion into critical infrastructure.

software-engineer.title: Set Up the Early Warning System
software-engineer.instruction: You need to deploy monitoring sensors across the power grid's control systems to catch the intrusion pattern before it escalates. Put the deployment steps in the right order.
software-engineer.hint: You can't spot anomalies without knowing what normal looks like. Set a baseline before you start looking for trouble.

items.label: Map all control system devices and how they're connected to each other
Install lightweight monitoring sensors on each control system device
Record 2 hours of normal behaviour to understand what 'healthy' looks like
Set alert thresholds based on the baseline; anything outside normal triggers a warning
Connect the alerts to the security team so they're notified the moment something unusual appears

data-scientist.title: Identify the Threat
data-scientist.instruction: The sensor readings show a pattern unlike anything in the history books. You have 30 minutes to classify the threat before leadership decides how to respond. What approach do you take?
data-scientist.hint: Novel threats are tricky for automated tools trained only on known patterns. More methods combined tend to give more reliable answers than one fast method alone.

options.label: Run the data through the automated threat detection system. Get an answer in 5 minutes, but the system was only trained on known attack patterns, and this looks new.
Manually compare the pattern against historical incidents and threat intelligence. Takes the full 30 minutes but produces a high-confidence answer.
Run three different detection methods and go with the majority verdict. Slower than one method alone but much more reliable against something new.
Share the anomaly signature with partner cybersecurity teams and ask if they've seen it. Could get an answer in 10 minutes but you'd be showing your hand to external parties.

cloud-engineer.title: Estimate How Far It Has Spread
cloud-engineer.instruction: The intrusion may have been active for a while. Based on the suspicion scores for network traffic over the last 4 days (higher = more suspicious activity), estimate how many of the 200 control system devices may already be compromised.
cloud-engineer.hint: The scores are rising fast. Look at where the trend is heading by the 4th day â€” that percentage of 200 gives you your estimate.
